    HYP: the Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto , meanwhile , said that his country also planned to build a barbed wire fence along its border with Romania to stop the influx of migrants through the country - after it has finished a fence along the Serbian border .

    HYP: Prime Minister Viktor Orban has insisted , however , that most of the economic refugees are arriving in search of a better life and not war refugees , who are entitled to protection - a view very much at odds with other EU countries , including Germany .

    HYP: the former Sky and Channel 5 chief executive David Elstein , who also testified before the committee on Tuesday , demanded that the BBC should review its Reithian mission to inform , educate and entertain. ``


  1003. REF: he said little of the BBC 's output was now formally classified as education - he said it was 1 % of its TV output and 0.1 % on radio - and it should take a lead from public service broadcasters in Australia and Canada and change it to `` inform , enlighten and entertain . ''

    HYP: he said that only a few of the BBC production would now officially classified as education - he said that 1 % of their TV production and 0.1 % on the radio - and it should be on the public television channels in Australia and Canada are an example of this change to `` inform , educate and entertain . ''

    HYP: on the issue of partnerships Elstein , the BBC should do more in areas such as the Proms , he said that only a handful will be shown on television , and make alliances with commercial channels said to make everything available online .

    HYP: `` Sono Genetics ' may control brain cells by sound waves

    HYP: the video shows how the nematodes change the direction at the moment in which they are irradiated with sound pulses .

    HYP: scientists have bred worms with genetically modified nervous systems that can be controlled by explosions of sound waves .

    HYP: the tiny nematodes change the direction at the moment in which they are irradiated with sound pulses that the threshold of human hearing at high frequencies in order to be heard .


  1009. REF: the pulses work by switching on motor neuron cells that are genetically modified to carry membrane channels that respond to ultrasonic waves .

    HYP: the impetus to work through the involvement of motor neuron cells that are genetically modified to carry the membrane channels that respond to ultrasonic waves .


  1010. REF: related : researchers read and write brain activity with light

    HYP: further on this subject : read and write brain activity with light .


  1011. REF: researchers said the worms demonstrate the power of a new procedure , dubbed sonogenetics , in which ultrasound can be used to activate a range of brain , heart and muscle cells from outside the body .

    HYP: the researchers said that the worms showed the power of a new procedure , called sono Genetics , where ultrasound can be used to create a series of brain , heart and muscle cells outside of the body .


  1012. REF: Sreekanth Chalasani , a researcher at the Salk Institute in La Jolla , California , told the Guardian that the procedure could one day replace deep-brain stimulation , an invasive procedure that delivers electrical pulses into people 's brains to treat symptoms of Parkinson 's disease .

    HYP: Sreekanth Chalasani , researchers at the Salk Institute in La Jolla , California , told the Guardian that the procedure will one day replace the deep-brain stimulation , an invasive procedure , the electrical impulses in the brain of people to treat the symptoms of Parkinson 's disease .

    HYP: thread worms do not usually respond to ultrasound , but Chalasani noted that they did when they were surrounded by a liquid with microscopic air bubbles .


  1014. REF: the bubbles , he found , amplify the ultrasonic waves which then pass inside the worms .

    HYP: the bubbles , he found that the ultrasonic waves that penetrate into the worms .


  1015. REF: the amplified ultrasound waves act on structures called TRP-4 ion channels , found in the membranes of some of the worms '' cells .

    HYP: the enhanced ultrasonic waves affect structures , the TRP-4 called ion channels in the membranes of cells , some of the worms are found .


  1016. REF: the sound waves make these ion channels open up and activate the cells they are attached to , according to a report in Nature Communications .

    HYP: the sound waves cause the opening of these ion channels and activate the cells to which they are assigned , according to a report in Nature Communications .

    HYP: by ultrasound-controlled nematodes to create genetically modified Chalasani , the worms so that some of their motor neurons TRP-4 ion channels .

    HYP: if he uses ultrasound to the modified creatures , the sound waves are reinforced by the micro-bubbles and transferred to the worms , where they turn on the modified motor neurons .

    HYP: the procedure has some similarities with Opto Genetics , a groundbreaking tool that enables scientists to neurons with pulses of light on and off .


  1020. REF: but Chalasani said that sonogenetics could have some advantages over that technique .

    HYP: but Chalasani said that sono Genetics may have some advantages over this technology .

    HYP: unlike light in an optical fiber to the desired position in the brain needs to be sent down to low-frequency ultrasonic waves pass through unimpeded and tissue in the brain from the top of the skull .

    HYP: 4 people killed after police fire rubber bullets at protesters in Nepal

    HYP: four people , including a 4-year-old boy , were killed in southern Nepal after police rubber bullets fired into a crowd of people who demonstrated against the proposed new constitution , an official said on Wednesday .


  1853. REF: the violence occurred Tuesday evening in the district of Rupandehi , about 175 miles west of Kathmandu , the capital .

    HYP: the violence erupted on Tuesday evening in Rupandehi district , about 175 miles west of the capital , Kathmandu .

  1855. REF: Mr. Dhakal said the police used tear gas and then fired into the air before resorting to rubber bullets .

    HYP: Mr Dhakal said that the police had used tear gas and fired into the air before they grip on rubber bullets .


  1856. REF: twenty police officers and five civilians were wounded , he said .

    HYP: 20 police officers and five civilians were injured , he said .

    HYP: it was not immediately clear why the use of rubber bullets is known by those that they can kill , but they are traditionally used as a less lethal alternative , apparently produced such a high death rate .

    HYP: there were also protests in western Nepal from the ethnic group of Tharus , who want a state of their own .

    HYP: work on a new constitution since 2008 is on the way , but the legislators accelerated the process after the devastating earthquake that had killed thousands of people in April .

    HYP: it is still too early to say whether slightly overweight people with diabetes after weight-loss surgery live longer than those who received non-surgical treatments .

    HYP: `` The mortality data takes a long time to get something to show , '' said Dr. Robin Blackstone , an expert in weight loss surgery , an editorial about the new study in JAMA Surgery .


  1919. REF: weight loss operations , or bariatric surgery , use various methods to shrink the size of the stomach .

    HYP: weight-loss surgery or obesity surgery , use different methods in order to reduce the size of the stomach .


  1920. REF: they reduce hunger and limit the body 's ability to absorb food .

    HYP: you reduce hunger and limit the body 's ability to absorb food .

    HYP: over the years , have obesity-surgery for the treatment of type 2 diabetes as efficient , but most studies have been carried out by people who are morbidly obese with a body mass index ( BMI ) of 35 or higher .


  1922. REF: BMI , a measure of weight in relation to height , is considered normal between 18.5 and 24.9 .

    HYP: BMI , a measure of weight in relation to height , is considered normal is between 18.5 and 24.9 .


  1923. REF: a BMI of 25 or higher indicates that someone is overweight , and people with a BMI over 30 are considered obese .

    HYP: a BMI of 25 or more indicates that someone is overweight , and people with a BMI over 30 are considered obese .


  1924. REF: you can calculate your BMI here : 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv .

    HYP: you can calculate your BMI here : 1.usa.gov / 1D0ZqDv .


  1925. REF: for the new study , researchers from Taiwan 's Min-Sheng General Hospital used data collected since 2007 in a trial comparing two kinds of bariatric surgery - gastric bypass and sleeve gastrectomy - to medical treatments for type 2 diabetes in people who were mildly obese .

    HYP: for the new study , researchers used from Taiwan 's Min-Sheng General Hospital data since 2007 , they have collected in a study and compare two types of obesity surgery , gastric bypass and gastric tube formation - to medical treatments for type 2 diabetes in people who were slightly overweight .


  1926. REF: the average BMI among those who had surgery fell from 31 to 24.5 by the end of their fifth year in the study .

    HYP: the average BMI among those who undergo this surgery fell from 31 to 24.5 by the end of the fifth year of the study .


  1927. REF: meanwhile , the BMI among those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatments stayed about the same at 29 .

    HYP: meanwhile , the BMI was among those non-surgical diabetes treatments were roughly equal at 29 .


  1928. REF: among those who had surgery , diabetes resolved completely in 36 percent and partially in 28 percent .

    HYP: among those who have undergone surgery , with 36 % of the total diabetes disease and at 28 % .


  1929. REF: in the medically-treated group , by comparison , diabetes resolved completely in only 1 percent and partially in only about 2 percent .

    HYP: in the medically-treated group disintegrated completely diabetes compared to only one percent , with only about two percent .


  1930. REF: in addition , control of blood pressure , triglycerides , and `` bad '' LDL cholesterol `` was generally better in the surgical group , '' the authors found .

    HYP: in addition , the results were in the control of blood pressure , triglycerides and `` bad '' LDL cholesterol `` generally better in the 'surgical ' group , '' the authors found .


  1931. REF: the researchers also monitored patients ' blood levels of hemoglobin A1c , which reflect blood sugar levels over time .

    HYP: the researchers also monitored the patient 's blood levels of hemoglobin A1c , blood sugar levels over time .


  1932. REF: hemoglobin A1c is best kept below 7 percent , the researchers write .

    HYP: hemoglobin A1c is best kept under 7 percent , the researchers write .


  1933. REF: after surgery , the average hemoglobin A1c level fell from about 9 percent to about 6 percent .

    HYP: after the surgery , the average hemoglobin A1c levels fell by about 9 percent to around 6 percent .

    HYP: in the medical therapy group , however , remained stable at around 8 % .

    HYP: so far , there is still no sufficient supply of general and work-related language courses .

    HYP: moreover , studies show that most jobs are conveyed through personal contacts .

    HYP: the development of networks is , therefore , in the opinion of Thrnhardt the royal road to integration .


  2320.   2978. REF: in a bid to open up state-controlled sectors , more areas will be open to private investment .

    HYP: in a bid to open state-controlled sectors , other areas will be opened up to private investment .


  2979. REF: `` The government will not change its policy toward foreign investment , and will protect the lawful interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better services for them , '' said the statement .

    HYP: `` The government will change its policy towards foreign investment and protect the legitimate interests of foreign-funded enterprises and provide better services for them , '' the statement said .


  2980. REF: in addition , it will be made easier for foreigners to apply for permanent residence permits , or `` green card , '' by optimizing requirements and streamlining the application process .

    HYP: in addition , it will make it easier for foreigners to apply for a permanent residence permit , or the `` Green Card '' by the requirements and the application process will be made easier .


  2981. REF: guaranteeing lawyers ' right to practice and nurturing professional judges and prosecutors were also discussed at a meeting .

    HYP: guaranteeing the right of lawyers to carry out their activities , and use professional judges and prosecutors , was also discussed at the meeting .


  2982. REF: the meeting was also attended by Premier Li Keqiang , and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli , according to a statement released after the meeting .

    HYP: also at the meeting , Premier Li Keqiang and prominent leaders like Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli attended , as was reported in a statement issued after the meeting .


  2983. REF: EU wants to double the mercury limit in predatory fish

    HYP: EU wants to limit mercury in carnivorous fish double


  2984. REF: the EU commission wants to double the limits for mercury in large predatory fish and consumers therefore can expect a significantly higher dose of this neurotoxin .

    HYP: the European Commission wants to double the limit for mercury in large predators and consumers expect a significantly higher dose of nerves gifts .


  2985. REF: the consumer organisation Foodwatch , to which an EU working paper on the subject was made available , is heavily critical of the plans . `` Risks and side effects of inappropriate industry and environmental politics will be passed on with full force to pregnant women and small children , '' declared Matthias Wolfschmidt of Foodwatch .

    HYP: the consumer organisation Food Watch , submitted a working paper of the European Union , sharply criticized the plans : `` The risks and side effects of misguided industrial and environmental policies with full force passed on pregnant women and young children , '' said Matthias Wolf Schmidt of the Watch .


  2986. REF: according to Wolfschmidt , the limits for the neurotoxin for large fish at the end of the food chain such as for example shark or swordfish are going to be raised from 1 to 2 mg of mercury per kilogram of fish for `` economic reasons '' .

    HYP: Wolf Schmidt , the limits of the nerve poison should be increased for large fish at the end of the food chain such as swordfish Hai- or for `` economic reasons '' from one to two milligrams of mercury per kilogram of fish .


  2987. REF: large predatory fish however are today so heavily contaminated with mercury that based on the still current limits some 50 percent of catches may not be sold .

    HYP: large predators are already burdened with so much mercury that approximately 50 percent of the catches should be based on the current limits have not yet sold .


  2988. REF: once the limit has been doubled , however , only 14.5 percent would be unsaleable .

    HYP: after doubling the limit then only 14.5 % would be unsaleable .


  2989. REF: in return for this relaxation the EU , according to Foodwatch , wants to tighten the limits for other fish from the current 0.5 mg to 0.1 mg of mercury per kilogram .

    HYP: in return , the EU wants to tighten this easing in food Watch the limits on other fish from the current 0.5 milligrams of 0.1 milligrams of mercury per kilogram .


  2990. REF: but Foodwatch describes this as a `` trick '' , because smaller prey fish , such as for example carp , generally have so little contamination that these planned maximum levels are already complied with today .

    HYP: food Watch described it as a `` trick '' because smaller Fried fish , such as carp are usually charged so low that they already comply with the proposed limits .


  2991. REF: the reduction for small fish therefore is `` a perfidious diversionary tactic which helps only the economy , '' declares Wolfschmidt .

    HYP: the reduction of small fish is therefore a perfides diversionary tactic that helps the economy alone , `` said Wolf Schmidt .


  2992. REF: Mercury is for human beings a highly toxic heavy metal which accumulates largely in the food chain , above all in predatory fish .

    HYP: Mercury is highly toxic to humans , a heavy metal that accumulates in the food chain , especially in carnivorous fish .


  2993. REF: for this reason the German government has issued a warning that `` even low levels , particularly in unborn children , can lead to damage to the nervous system '' .

    HYP: therefore , the federal government warns that `` even small amounts can cause great damage to the nervous system in the unborn . ''


  2994. REF: the German Environment Minister , however , declared on his home page with regard to the current maximum levels that a `` health risk to the general population '' is not anticipated .

    HYP: the Federal Ministry for the Environment said on its website in relation to the current levels , but that a `` health risk to the general population '' is not expected .


  2995. REF: Mercury is released into the environment primarily through the burning of coal .

    HYP: Mercury mainly by the burning of coal in the environment .


  2996. REF: German coal plants , according to written information from the German Ministry of the Environment to Green Bundestag member Annalena Baerbock , discharge more than six tonnes of mercury per year , two thirds of the total amount emitted in Germany .

    HYP: the German coal-fired power plants to meet a written information of the German Federal Ministry for Environment at the Green members Anna Lena Baer wanted more than six tonnes of mercury per year , two-thirds of the total issued in Germany .


  2997. REF: the concentration of mercury in fish , for example in the Elbe , Rhine and Danube , is `` extensively exceeded on a long-term basis , '' the `` Spiegel '' newspaper quoted from the paper in March .

    HYP: the concentration of mercury in fish such as Elbe , Rhine and Danube was `` permanently and all the '' mirror `` in March exceeded '' from the paper , was quoted as saying .


  2998. REF: in the past year , Europe-wide alerts on mercury in fish rated among the most frequently reported health risks in the EU warning system RASFF .

    HYP: in the past year were Europe-wide warnings about mercury in fish is already among the most common reported health risks in the EU alert system RASFF .


  2999. REF: Foodwatch is calling for consumers to protest against the EU plans under : www.quecksilber-aktion.foodwatch.de

    HYP: food Watch reminds consumers to protest against the plans of the EU to below : Www.quecksilber-aktion.foodwatch.de
